intro: Erigeron gayanus, commonly known as the Gay's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron gayanus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
